intro: Calceolaria extensa, commonly known as the Peruvian slipper orchid, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of Peru. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its unique, slipper-shaped flowers that are typically violet or purple in color. The plant produces small, bell-shaped leaves and thrives in cool, high-altitude environments. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking floral display. Calceolaria extensa is also noted for its ability to adapt to rocky and well-drained soils.
